physical_examinations.vital_signs: Normal vital signs; oxygen saturation 100% on ambient air.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was alert, oriented but slow to respond; slurred speech; normal pupils and extraocular movements; 1+ symmetric deep-tendon reflexes.
The patient was alert, oriented, communicative, and restless in the morning; normal strength, full eye movements, reactive pupils, mild ataxia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Difficulty walking, violent shaking, and inability to speak developed by approximately 11:30 a.m.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mechanical ventilation with intubation; head tonic deviation to the left; pupils 3 mm and weakly reactive; corneal reflexes present; increased tone in arms held extended; extensor tone in legs with sustained clonus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased extension of arms and triple flexion response with no response to verbal commands; extensor posturing developed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Post-procedure: did not open eyes or follow commands but pupils reactive and gag/cough reflexes present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improved the next day with ability to swallow, cough, move extremities, nod 'yes' and 'no'; hyperactive deep-tendon reflexes and bilateral ankle clonus.
